alert.note: Alert for Northern Hancock; Southern Hancock; Southern Harrison (Mississippi) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 05 at 6:20PM CDT by NWS New Orleans
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of east central St. Tammany Parish in southeastern Louisiana and southern Hancock Counties through 645 PM CDT... At 620 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Stennis Space Center, or 10 miles south of Picayune, moving southeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Bay St. Louis, Waveland, Diamondhead, Pearl River, Pearlington, Shoreline Park, Stennis Space Center and Kiln. This includes the following Interstates... Interstate 10 in Louisiana between mile markers 272 and 273. Interstate 10 in Mississippi between mile markers 1 and 16. Interstate 59 in Louisiana between mile markers 4 and 8. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: Torrential rainfall is occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.

area.areaDesc: Northern Hancock; Southern Hancock; Southern Harrison
